other_tests.findings: Appendix is fluid-filled and dilated up to 12 mm, with surrounding fat stranding and inflammatory change extending to the base of the cecum. Mild atelectasis noted at the lung bases. No evidence of focal lesions in liver, pancreas, spleen, or adrenal glands. Normal kidneys and gastrointestinal tract, with hazy misty appearance in the mesentery consistent with mesenteric panniculitis.
